body_html:
I'm really looking forward to an implementation of in-session queue resetting, and hope this will be coming soon.

This would enable repeated evaluation of an enqueued validation set, where (epoch_size % batch_size > 0) in a single session. I thought this was a rather common case, and am a bit surprised there is no good support in TensorFlow for this scenario.

Currently we are resorting to complicated hacks that emit undefined behavior, and I cannot get the proposed workaround using multiple sessions to work.
body_text:
I'm really looking forward to an implementation of in-session queue resetting, and hope this will be coming soon.
This would enable repeated evaluation of an enqueued validation set, where (epoch_size % batch_size > 0) in a single session. I thought this was a rather common case, and am a bit surprised there is no good support in TensorFlow for this scenario.
Currently we are resorting to complicated hacks that emit undefined behavior, and I cannot get the proposed workaround using multiple sessions to work.
body:
I'm _really_ looking forward to an implementation of in-session queue resetting, and hope this will be coming soon.

This would enable repeated evaluation of an enqueued validation set, where (epoch_size % batch_size > 0) in a single session. I thought this was a rather common case, and am a bit surprised there is no good support in TensorFlow for this scenario.

Currently we are resorting to complicated hacks that [emit undefined behavior](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41187745/tensorflow-how-can-i-evaluate-a-validation-data-queue-multiple-times-during-tra), and I cannot get the proposed workaround using multiple sessions to work.
